intro: Mapouria onivensis, commonly known as the Ivory Coast maple, is a deciduous tree native to West Africa. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The tree produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters, followed by spherical fruits that split open to release seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
